Package se.arkalix.net.http

Interface HttpBodySender<Self>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HttpServiceResponse
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpClientRequest, HttpConsumerRequest

    • Method Detail

      • body

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Object> body()
        Gets outgoing HTTP body, if any is set.
        Returns:
        Any currently set response body.

      • body

        Self body​(byte[] byteArray)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided byte array is scheduled for transmission to the outgoing body receiver as-is. It becomes the responsibility of the caller to ensure that any "content-type" header is set appropriately.

        Parameters:
        byteArray - Bytes to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.

      • body

        Self body​(DtoEncoding encoding,
          DtoWritable data)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided writable data transfer object is scheduled for encoding and transmission to the receiver of the body. Please refer to the Javadoc for the @DtoWritableAs annotation for more information about writable data transfer objects.

        Parameters:
        encoding - Encoding to use when encoding data.
        data - Data transfer object to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If encoding or body is null.
        See Also:
        @DtoWritableAs

      • body

        default Self body​(DtoEncoding encoding,
                  DtoWritable... data)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided array of writable data transfer objects are scheduled for encoding and transmission to the receiver of the body. Please refer to the Javadoc for the @DtoWritableAs annotation for more information about writable data transfer objects.

        Parameters:
        encoding - Encoding to use when encoding data.
        data - Data transfer objects to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If encoding or body is null.
        See Also:
        @DtoWritableAs

      • body

        Self body​(DtoEncoding encoding,
          java.util.List<DtoWritable> data)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided list of writable data transfer objects are scheduled for encoding and transmission to the receiver of the body. Please refer to the Javadoc for the @DtoWritableAs annotation for more information about writable data transfer objects.

        Parameters:
        encoding - Encoding to use when encoding data.
        data - Data transfer objects to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If encoding or body is null.
        See Also:
        @DtoWritableAs

      • body

        Self body​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The contents of the file at the provided file system path are scheduled for transmission to the receiver of the body as-is. It becomes the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the "content-type" header is set appropriately.

        Parameters:
        path - Path to file to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If path is null.

      • body

        Self body​(java.lang.String string)
        Sets outgoing HTTP body, replacing any previously set such.

        The provided string is scheduled for transmission to the outgoing HTTP receiver as-is. It becomes the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the "content-type" header is set appropriately. If no charset is specified in the "content-type", one that is acceptable to the receiver of the body will be used if possible.

        Parameters:
        string - String to send to receiver of the body.
        Returns:
        This.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If string is null.

      • clearBody

        Self clearBody()
        Removes any currently set outgoing HTTP body.
        Returns:
        This.
